name: SetPlayerCanPickpocketEquippedItems
desc: Toggles the ability to pickpocket equipped items

name: GetPlayerCanPickpocketEquippedItems
desc: Checks if the player can pickpocket equipped items

name: GetPCHasSleepWaitOverride
desc: Returns whether or not the player has a Sleep/Wait prevention override

name: SetPCHasSleepWaitOverride
desc: Sets whether or not the player has a Sleep/Wait prevention override

name: ShowingOffDisable
desc: Does the same thing as vanilla Disable. For showing off!

name: ShowingOffEnable
desc: Does the same thing as vanilla Enable. For showing off!

name: GetNumActorsInRangeFromRef
desc: Returns the amount of actors that are a certain distance nearby to the calling reference

name: GetNumCombatActorsFromActor
desc: Returns the amount of actors that are allies/targets to the calling actor, with optional filters

name: IsWeaponMelee
desc: Returns 1 if the weapon's base form is of one of the three weapon types belonging to melee-range weapons

name: IsEquippedWeaponMelee
desc: Returns 1 if the calling actor's equipped weapon's base form is of one of the three weapon types belonging to melee-range weapons

name: IsWeaponRanged
desc: Returns 1 if the weapon's base form is one of the weapon types belonging to NON melee-range weapons

name: IsEquippedWeaponRanged
desc: Returns 1 if the calling actor's equipped weapon's base form is one of the weapon types belonging to NON melee-range weapons

name: GetChallengeProgress
desc: Returns the progress made on a challenge

name: ConditionPrint
desc: Returns 1, and prints a message to console. Meant for testing if previous conditions passed

name: ListAddArray_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: IsAnimPlayingExCond
desc: Same as IsAnimPlayingEx, but available as a condition. Had to cut the variationFlags filter

name: GetNumCompassHostiles
desc: Returns the amount of hostile actors on compass, w/ optional filters

name: IsNight
desc: Returns true if it's night according to the current (or specified) climate

name: IsLimbCrippled
desc: If no args are passed / arg is -1, returns true if actor has any crippled limbs. Otherwise, checks if the specified limb is crippled

name: GetCalculatedEquippedWeight
desc: Accounts for perk effects + weapon mods

name: GetCalculatedMaxCarryWeight
desc: Accounts for GetMaxCarryWeight perk entry

name: SetShowOffDebugMode
desc: Set to 1 to enable debug prints for certain ShowOff functions

name: IsReferenceCloned
desc: Checks if the reference's modIndex is 0xFF

name: AdvanceSeed
desc: Discards would-be generated numbers to advance in the seed generation pattern

name: IsTemporaryReference
desc: Checks if the reference does not persist in the savegame

name: GetPCHasScriptedFastTravelOverride
desc: Returns whether or not the player is restricted by EnableFastTravel

name: DisableAlt
desc: Ignores the EnableParent limitation

name: EnableAlt
desc: Ignores the EnableParent limitation

name: GetCalculatedSkillPoints
desc: Gets the amount of skill points the player would get for their current level

name: GetCalculatedPerkPoints
desc: Gets the amount of perk points the player would get for their current level

name: ShowPerkMenu
desc: Opens the Level-Up menu to the Perk-menu page, and prevents going back to Skills tab

name: ShowSkillMenu
desc: Opens the Level-Up menu to the Skills page, and sets that this is the last page (no visiting perks)

name: GetExplosionRefRadius
desc: Accounts for AdjustExplosionRadius perk entry point

name: GetActorValueDamage
desc: Returns the damage modifier applied to the actor's AV

name: SetNoEquipShowOff
desc: Sets whether or not there's a prevention for an item baseform from being activated from an actor's inventory

name: GetNoEquipShowOff
desc: Returns whether or not there's a prevention for an item baseform from being activated from an actor's inventory

name: SetFactionCombatReactionTemp
desc: Sets the combat reaction between two factions. Unlike SetAlly/SetEnemy, isn't savebaked

name: GetEquippedItemRefForItem
desc: Returns the equipped inv ref for the base item if that base item is equipped

name: SetAllyTemp
desc: Sets the combat reaction between two factions to something friendly. Unlike SetAlly, isn't savebaked

name: SetEnemyTemp
desc: Sets the combat reaction between two factions to enemy/neutral status. Unlike SetEnemy, isn't savebaked

name: TopicInfoSetResponseStrings_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: GetItemCanHaveHealth
desc: Returns 1 if the item form can be given health data, 0 otherwise

name: GetZoneRespawns
desc: Returns if an Encounter Zone has the NoRespawn flag set or not

name: SetOwnershipTemp
desc: A mix of SetOwnership and SetCellOwnership, but non-savebaked

name: IsActorAlt
desc: Same as IsActor but accepts an optional baseform

name: ApplyEasing
desc: Applies the chosen easing function to a progress value (situtated between 0 and 1)

name: Matrix_IsMatrix_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Matrix3x3_GetQuaternion_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Quaternion_GetMatrix_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Matrix_Transpose_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Matrix_Dump_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Matrix_ApplyOperationWithScalar_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Matrix_ApplyOperationWithMatrix_OLD
desc: |DEPRECATED|

name: Matrix_IsMatrix
desc: Checks if an array is convertible to a matrix

name: Matrix3x3_GetQuaternion
desc: Returns a quaternion from a 3x3 matrix

name: Quaternion_GetMatrix
desc: Returns a 3x3 rotation matrix from a quaternion array

name: Matrix_Transpose
desc: Returns the transpose of the array matrix

name: Matrix_Dump
desc: Dumps the matrix array in console, in matrix notation

name: Matrix_ApplyOperationWithScalar
desc: Returns the matrix affected by an operation by a scalar

name: Matrix_ApplyOperationWithMatrix
desc: Returns the matrix operation result between two matrix arrays

name: GetCalculatedItemValue
desc: Returns the item's value, affected by condition and any attached weapon mods (and extra)

name: GetPosArray
desc: Returns an array of the 3 axis positions of a reference

name: GetIsPlayerOverencumbered
desc: An alternative to SUP's IsPlayerOverencumbered

name: AuxTimerStart
desc: Starts an auxvar timer on a form, or can restart it if exists already

name: AuxTimerStop
desc: Stops/erases an auxvar timer on a form

name: AuxTimerPaused
desc: Gets/Sets if an auxvar timer is paused

name: AuxTimerTimeElapsed
desc: Gets how much time passed since timer started (limited by the original countdown time)

name: AuxTimerTimeToCountdown
desc: Gets the original countdown time

name: AuxTimerTimeLeft
desc: Gets the time left for the countdown, -1 if it does not exist
